answers.answer: To be honest I would act like you have only just literally found out and you tell them straight away acting like you are in shock etc, sounds dishonest but not really considering you want to stay there a long time and I think it will be easier for you in the long run x
I agree act like you just found out I did that before when I started a new job and it worked out well
What I'd they ask how far along I am... 16 weeks? Should be well known by 16 weeks..

If wait a while. I didn't share my news until I was showing with my first. It doesn't affect your job so no need to tell and legally they can't ask you. Most people don't tell when they first find out anyway.

I was 8 weeks with my first when I got my new job and told them I had a drs appointment one day around 14 weeks cuz I didn't feel right and my next day working j told my boss they found a baby when they ultra sounded my belly... she was super excited for me and was supportive throughout the pregnancy... I was taken out of work at 7-8 months due to preeclampsia and she said my job is waiting for me when/if I want it... good luck

I was 16 weeks when I was offered a new job, I accepted it and told the manager I'm pregnant over the phone. There is nothing they can do once you're offered a job. When I interviewed for it I was only 9 weeks, I hadn't even told family yet!I was 20 weeks on my first day and not really showing yet, but it was a relief to start and have them know so they could plan for maternity fill in position to cover me straight away. I never explained whether I knew I was pregnant or not at the interview, as i have every right to this job just like everyone else who applied and interviewed... Unfortunately managers find it an inconvenience that we want to start our families. Well done on being the best applicant!!

I'm in the same position. I'll be delivering during the busiest time of the year for my job and I've accepted the position of manager. I think I'm going to wait until I start showing before I tell them. I am only 16 weeks at the moment and still able to hide it. Good luck
I started a new job at 22 weeks and I told them on my first day. They cant fire you or anything. They should be understanding.

I told my boss when I was about 10 weeks because I was going to and from the bathroom because of morning sickness. I suggest u only tell who u nees to tell until u start to show. This is about the tome to let them know so they can properly prepare for ur absences.
I would wait till I'm showing.  If they don't ask and it doesn't interfere, don't say anything.
I just want to do what's right. Thanks for all the advice!!

Or you can wait until your about to deliver... just say ahhh I have to go run an errand then email a pic of the baby. Im kidding. I would say wait until you are showing if you are not close with you boss. If you have a good rapport with them then I would say maybe a bit earlier but just play semi shocked. Most jobs just want reassurance that you can do the job. If they value your work they will be supportive.

question: Hey ladies, I recently got a new job and plan to stay there for a really long time. I'm 16 weeks pregnant and I didn't drop the news yet that I am. How would you go about telling your new boss that you are expecting?
title: a new job.. how do i let them know?
